page.statement:
To complete this module you need to pass the following assessment; the passmark is 100%.

We recommend you read the questions carefully before answering. Once you have moved on you cannot return to previous questions.

question.ans: The presence of parasites in raw food
The transfer of cleaning chemicals to high-risk food
The transfer of bacteria from raw food to high-risk food

question.text: Which of the following pairs is most likely to transfer food poisoning bacteria to high-risk food?
Which of the following are all likely sources of physical contaminants?
question.ans: Maintenance operatives, equipment, pests and high-risk food
Buildings, equipment, food handlers and raw meats
Buildings, equipment, notice boards and cleaning chemicals
Food handlers, visitors, cleaning activities and sabotage

question.text: Which of the following is a serious chemical contaminant of food?
Which of the following statements is true?
question.ans: Food allergens cause the body's immune system to react
The most significant source of food-poisoning bacteria is high-risk food
Walls and floors are important vehicles of contamination
Food handlers are not a source of food poisoning organisms

question.text: Which of the following foreign bodies often originates from packaging and may result in physical contamination of food?
Which of the following are all common allergens?
Which of the following are all likely physical contaminants from food handlers?
question.ans: Earrings, a blue plaster and pen tops
Food poisoning bacteria, pen tops and hair
